comments.value:
Follow these instructions carefully. Danny and I have reproduced on FF3.0.4, FF3.6.2, Safari 4, Chrome & Opera.

1. Visit http://www.london2012.com/indexb.php.
2. Scroll down to the very bottom of the page (so you can see the BT logo).
3. Wait for 2 or 3 seconds.

What happens?
When the "Commercial partners" and "Public funders" logos scroll, for some reason the main page scrolls up slightly, thereby hiding the BT logo!!

Do you know why this might be happening (and/or who is responsible for that code)?

Thanks,

Kieran

It's a known issue,

Some of the logo's (BMW is an example) are bigger than others, so push 
the page down when it loads.

LOCOG need to go back to the original logos/images (so as to not 
degrade them too much) and shrink them all to the same [smaller] size, 
have mentioned it to Liz.

(we could do this if we had access to the original images, but would 
be chargeable work)

Jamie
Ok - just thought I'd draw attention to it, given the hullaballoo over the BT logo last night!

It may be a known issue, but that doesn't mean Liz wouldn't want it to be a priority and I don't think we have a ticket for it yet. I suggest changing the ownership of this ticket to Liz, so she can see it and prioritise it if desired.
Should prob. give her an effort estimate first?

Liz, I have made you the requester of this ticket (originally raised by Kieran), because I thought you would want to see it. Given the kerfuffle about the disappearing BT logo I am guessing this is likely to be a high (possibly very high) priority for you. It may be worth reading through the comments already on the ticket and then trying it out for yourself. You should be able to replicate it on any browser. It's potentially embarrassing, I think (and also quite funny). Jamie thinks you may already know about it, but just in case, here it is again.

Regarding Kieran's comment above about an estimate, it depends on whether you would like us to re-do the images or not, but it is unlikely to be much work at all.

I'm sorry - i don't understand what we need to do? and is the bt logo actually fixed? we DEFINITELY NEED TO TREAT THAT AS TOP PRIORITY. If it's still disappearing, we've got to sort it out IMMEDIATELY.

Do we need to resize the commercial logos? We can do, but they were put in based on the guidelines that were given to us by you/cogapp. if they're proving problematic, then we need to know what size they are meant to be! We haven't ever changed them.

 _____

p.s. definitely NOT a known issue over here.

 _____
OK. I am assuming it's high then. We need you to do new versions of the images or for you to send us the originals to re-do them for you.

What you have in the CMS is probably the closest thing i have to an 'original'. What size do you actually need?? We can probably do the crops, but I have to know what size we're aiming for.

and I apologise if i'm being dim, but i really, really don't think this has been mentioned before in terms of it having an affect on the BT logo...

 _____

Liz, you are being dim at all. We only noticed the problem yesterday, although Jamie's diagnosis is related to something he has mentioned before which is that the partner logos are a bit on the big side.

Jamie, over to you for sizes.
er, that should have read: "you are NOT being dim at all".

They all need to be on a consistent 157x65px background, basically make a 157x65px white image and then copy/paste the logo onto it and resize using Cntrl-T and Shift (I think it's that on the PC for transform keeping aspect ratio) so they all fit the same. Then save them out as png using save-for-web.

You can just 'reload' them in the CMS (they all live in /images/sponsors/)

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/images/sponsors/commercial-partners.xml

If you have the originals it would be better to go back to them as reducing already reduced images can end up with fuzzy resolution. But realise that may not be possible.

(sorry Liz I was meaning to bring this up with you as I was reminded of it, as we're you I expect, when looking at the new footer - normally I never scroll that far down the page !)

Jamie

Thanks - will see what I can do!

 _____

seriously? They need to be only 65 tall? that's literally HALF of what's there now... isn't it going to look really bizarre in that space if the logos are half their current height? There will be too much whitespace? Apologies, but i'm really confused again.

 _____

ok, having thrown my fit, i've done the cropping. may not be *perfect as don't have photoshop on this machine, but will do for the weekend! i'll go reload now...

 _____

actually, no i'm not! because having just checked, i think the same pictures are being pulled into the commercial partner PAGE, where they *are* the right size! i don't want to make those ones shrink...

could you please change the path of where the correctly sized pictures (From the homepage) are going to be pulled from? well, don't do it before there are photos in there, but tell me what to do!

 _____

Hi Liz,

You can edit the path to them here..
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/images/sponsors/commercial-partners.xml

Jamie

But this means I need to upload new photos, not reload, right? B/c if I
reload the smaller images will appear on the sponsors page?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Exactly, upload new ones if the current ones are shared

Might be best to just make a complete new set / folder of images that 
are only used on the homepage.

Yeah, was thinking that.

 

Of course the pics are now on my laptop, so will probably need to wait
to tomorrow! I'll give it a whirl, then, and let you know if I have
problems.

 

 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012

Date proposed - April 9

I think this might be something that can be managed by removing the min-height attribute from div#image-gallery-container (or rather replacing the div with a new "#download-image-container" id with no minimum height attribute), in which case we don't need any new templates, just a change to the existing template. Half a day.

Will it force the narrower images to stretch? So long as it doesn't
make them look wobbly it's no real problem!

splendid. thanks.

Afraid we'll have to do a new template as the resizing rules are different from what we have at the maps. Nothing terribly complicated though.

Just to clarify the dimensions, is it
300x250
160x600
and 468x_90_? (standarad is either 468x60 or 728x90, probably latter is more popular now)

I'm checking with the Inspire team...

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/photos/downloads/banners/test300x250.php

nb download link will download the original size.

Liz, the work is done, pending your approval and is 0.3 days.

Excellent.  Think we're getting approval from Inspire Team.  Can you please amend the Ts and Cs for these templates to the following:

DOWNLOAD INSPIRE ADVERT  

The above adverts (the "Inspire Adverts") have been created to promote the London 2012 Inspire programme and can be downloaded for inclusion as adverts in national and local newspapers and magazines and in non-commercial publications (including any online versions of such publications) in the United Kingdom only.  They may not be reproduced outside the United Kingdom (or in the case of websites, on websites whose primary target audience is not in the United Kingdom), and may not be reproduced in or on any corporate publications or websites which have the purpose of promoting a business, brand or product.  The London 2012 Inspire mark and Inspire Adverts are © The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited (LOCOG) 2008 - 2010. All rights reserved.

Please email inspire@london2012.com to let us know where you are publishing the Inspire Advert so we can keep track of how and where it's being used.

[tick box] I acknowledge that all rights in and to the London 2012 Inspire mark and Inspire Adverts are and shall remain vested in LOCOG, its licensees or assignees.  I agree to reproduce the Inspire Adverts only for the purposes described above; not to alter the content of the Inspire Adverts in any way; and not use the Inspire Adverts in any way which may suggest that I (or the publication in which the Inspire Advert will appear), or any other third party, is associated with the London 2012 Inspire programme, LOCOG or the Olympic or Paralympic movement more generally.  I agree to discontinue all use of the Inspire Advert after 30 September 2012 and, upon request of LOCOG for any reason, shall withdraw and discontinue all use of the Inspire Advert.

Liz, as this copy is going into the template, can you just confirm whether these pages are going to be translated into French (and therefore will need to be tagged for inclusion in the language bundles).

no, not in french.

 _____
OK. That's done. Please check it and satisfy yourself that the template will accomodate the relevant image sizes and that the download is working and let us know if you have any problems.

6am Monday
----------
Deploy splash page in front of London2012.com
Swap in new Ticketing promo and ensure it points to www.tickets.london2012.com
Add Ticketing tab into global architecture of london2012.com and ensure it is published in site

Marking as authorized, although there is arguably some double counting going on here as you had me (billed separately) and Jamie (not billed) and Lars all up at 6am checking everything was OK. I am not sure you asked for three of us, but that's what you got.

I am happy with this - belt and braces!

comments.value: Specifically for ticketing pre-sign up, but also for Vancouver 2012 and other eventualities. Date is provisional.

H Morag,

The new emergency homepage may be part of this (addressed in a separate ticket)

But are you commissioning a light weight homepage for ticketing (ie. no login links and with the main focus being a link to Ticketmaster and the final confirmation page on Ticketmaster having a link back to the normal homepage) or do you just want all traffic re-directed direct to the lOndon2102 page on Ticketmaster for the launch?

Actually more to the point, are you expecting anything of us re. this ticket and if so what ;-) even if it's just 'can you make suggestions'

thanks

Jamie

Hi Jamie

 

A timely email! We have indeed commissioned a lightweight splash page
for Ticketing launch, with exactly the contents you describe.

 

I can send you an early version of this - we are using it to do some
load tests with on the BT servers.

 

The user journey will be as follows:

 

Most marketing will take people directly to Ticketmaster at the URL
tickets.london2012.com. We will redirect london2012.com/tickets to
Ticketmaster too but we want to keep people off our infrastructure as
much as possible.

 

People who come to our home page through search will follow the links on
the splash page onto Ticketmaster or into our site.

 

When our splash page is finalised we will send it to you and will need
you to put it live at the appointed time on the day (towards end of
March). We would also be likely to need your help if we get too much
traffic and have to put up a 'come back later' page.

 

Does that sound okay?

________________________________
Have renamed this from: "Contingency plan for increased traffic". Pushed the date to March 31st and set as pending, i.e. awaiting arrival of splash page
Done. See http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/708

subject: Splash page for ticketing launch
description: Specifically for ticketing pre-sign up, but also for Vancouver 2012 and other eventualities. Date is provisional.

short url tool for you
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/shorturls/

Jamie

conflict with it. But that's great!

comments.value: I'm not completely sure this is an issue related to our web site, but users on IE7 are reporting that if they do Print Preview on pages on our website (in this instance, the Olympic Stadium page) they get a blank screen and a page tally at the bottom which runs to hundreds. When I click Print Preview in IE8 it is absolutely fine however. Could there be a problem with printing our website pages in some browsers? Or do you think it is a user-related problem?
Janos, could you take a quick look at this and let Morag know if you can replicate the behaviour in IE7.

Hmm, nice ie7 bug. I'll copy this here for historians: http://www.stemkoski.com/soltution-for-the-internet-explorer-7-endless-printing-bug/

Should be fixed now.
Many thanks for that.

Splendid! Well detected, Janos. I was convinced this was a classic
PICNIC (Problem In Chair, Not In Computer)

 

Thanks!

________________________________

subject: Print preview issue
description: I'm not completely sure this is an issue related to our web site, but users on IE7 are reporting that if they do Print Preview on pages on our website (in this instance, the Olympic Stadium page) they get a blank screen and a page tally at the bottom which runs to hundreds. When I click Print Preview in IE8 it is absolutely fine however. Could there be a problem with printing our website pages in some browsers? Or do you think it is a user-related problem?

thanks
michael

I pasted text from notepad that had the para breaks in, but when I saved
and then did preview the para breaks had gone. I went back in to edit
the page, typed them back in again, saved, previewed, they'd gone again.

 

 

________________________________

From: Michael Kowalski
[mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 21 October 2009 09:08
To: Deborah Elstein
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: paragraph breaks

I think we have one outstanding issue here, which is if you paste in paragraphs into an empty text box. We'll hopefully have a fix for that shortly. In the short term, a workaround that may help is to type in something (say, a space) before you do the paste, and then edit it out.
Duplicate of 120
This ticket was closed and merged into ticket #120 "Formatting pages - esp paragraph...".

description: Just noticed that when you go on the "Get Involved" page, the purple/pink underline on the menu remains under "Home". If you go on "Making it Happen", the purple/pink underline moves to that tab, which is correct behaviour. Could you possibly have a look at this?

comments.value: See http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/561. Once this is fixed, we will need to go through old images and attempt to add Alt tags back in. Due date is provisional.
Set to pending, awaiting authorization and approval of due date

Fine. Keep pending. But Ticket 561 is a priority.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Hi Liz,
I have identified 85 images that don't have any alt text.
I've (hopefully helpfully) collected them on the following page:
  http://london2012dev.kitsite.com/images.php
I will send you the username/password separately, in case you don't have it.
Please note, you can click on any of these images in order to open them in the CMS, from where you can edit the alt text.
Once this is done, this will - I believe - mean that all of the (known) alt text issues are fixed.
I hope this is helpful.
Kieran

That's fantastic! Thank you.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Am marking this ticket as solved.
If - however - you have any issues fixing this list of alt-text-less images, please open a new ticket.
It should work ok though, so any such future ticket should not be billable.

This is Fantastic, Kieran. I've started some now, but it will be of great help.

 _____
Marking as authorized.

subject: Cleanup of images without Alt text
description: See http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/561. Once this is fixed, we will need to go through old images and attempt to add Alt tags back in. Due date is provisional.

comments.value:
We need to republish the site in a way that minimises disruption in order to be ready to put the ticketing nav live for launch on Monday (as well as to be able to put live other work that is completed).

See:
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/664
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/645

You will need to co-ordinate with Lars who will be working on the new code this week, but my guess is that we will want to have the site re-published before Monday morning, but after Lars has made necessary changes to the navigation.
see http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/706

This was all completed yesterday, correct?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

All completed. And as a bonus, Kieran has spotted an optimization that should make it quicker next time. Also, we published everything as "low priority", so any pages published independently should not have been affected (unlike last time).

Excellent! Let's close this, then.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________
hm.  why is this .3 of a day?  sorry for being pedantic, but we can't really afford to pay for republishing the site, every time we republish it?

The time was largely spent writing a procedure that we can follow in the future.
The next time we do it (tomorrow, I believe) it will more-or-less just be a matter of "pressing a button". i.e. all other things being equal, next time it will be zero days.
(P.S. no apology due!)

In general it's a good thing to do such things...but you didn't tell us
you were doing it! After you had already recorded your time, you said, 

"And as a bonus, Kieran has spotted an optimization that should make it
quicker next time." I like bonuses...just not ones that have already
been decided for me!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Sorry, this should have been made clearer. There are two different things being talked about here.

1. "Republishing the site" is a task which arises relatively often. Upon this occasion, I spent a small amount of extra time developing a routine that we can run on the next occasion which will result in our billable time being zero. This, I have billed for.

2. The "optimization" that Danny mentioned was not technically related to this ticket, and - as such - is probably confusing matters. What happened was that I noticed that some pages were slow to publish (Events pages, fwiw) and spent some time speeding them up (massively; i.e. from about 10 sec each to about 1 sec each). This led to the actual process of publication being much quicker. This I did NOT bill for (as - you're right - it was neither requested nor authorized).

I hope this makes sense?
Kieran

Let's close this!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________
Marking as authorized, but, Liz, your comments are noted and we agree that we need to be more careful about getting anything but the smallest bits of work (<0.1  day?) signed off before proceeding.

comments.value:
On sports (and paralympic sports) pages there are 'venue' boxes in the top right, that say the name of the venue.  We want to change this to say 'Venue: ' before the name.  So right now where it says, 'Aquatics Centre' it would say, 'Venue: Aquatics centre'.  For some sports, it's not at all clear why there are these random buildings on the top of the pages!

This comes under feedback from the usability testing - which I *think* we agreed would go towards the ODA. Danny, can you confirm if i'm remembering properly?

Quote please?

Date proposed as 16 March.

So basically prefixing the name with 'Venue:"

The danger is that will break almost all titles over two lines, no?

Do you still want us to do it?

Well, the 2 line thing is a bit of a bummer, but I can't think of
another way to do it so it's clear what those things actually *are*. Do
you guys have any inspired ideas?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Hi Liz,

Oh that's what they are, I always thought they were photos of a rather fine assortment of steel fruit bowls !!

Have updated do you want to check you happy, if you are we can republish all the sports page en-mass for you.   
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/aquatics-diving.php

Have attached screengrab of a version where the 'Venue:' is outside of the link (personally I prefer it all in Blue)

Jamie

Cool - thanks. Looks good! 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

subject: add the word 'venue' in the right hand column of sports pages
description:
On sports (and paralympic sports) pages there are 'venue' boxes in the top right, that say the name of the venue.  We want to change this to say 'Venue: ' before the name.  So right now where it says, 'Aquatics Centre' it would say, 'Venue: Aquatics centre'.  For some sports, it's not at all clear why there are these random buildings on the top of the pages!

This comes under feedback from the usability testing - which I *think* we agreed would go towards the ODA. Danny, can you confirm if i'm remembering properly?

Quote please?

Date proposed as 16 March.
